summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 6, 2019. The sheets are for tiers ZB, ZA, U, M, ZA, and ZA (again, labeled with different tier letters like -G, -H, -J, -K). They document the required irregular observation rounds for inmates in locked-down status, reviewed by a Lieutenant and Captain.

events.title: Inmate Observation Rounds at MCC NY SHU
events.description: Standard 30-minute check sheets were completed for inmates in the Special Housing Unit, documenting staff observations as per protocol for inmates in administrative detention or disciplinary segregation.

locations: MCC New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison check sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated July 6, 2019.
It shows the protocol for observing inmates in locked-down status (administrative detention/disciplinary segregation) at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, though their specific names are not provided in the text.
The document is part of standard prison operational records and does not mention any specific inmates or staff by name.
Multiple tiers (ZB, ZA-G, ZA-H, U, M, ZA-J, ZA-K) are represented, indicating checks across different sections of the SHU.
